Message:
I’d always resented
the human part of me.

Whenever I was distraught
over my inability
to be like Mother,
she’d gently lick my fur
and tell me this...

“You are fine as you are.
We may look different,
but you are still my daughter.”

Even though those words...
were from the heart...!

I ran to Mother’s side
to lift the fallen pillar.

...It moved a little...!
If I just push a little more...!

Even if my body burns to ash...
I’m going to save you, Mother...!

“Ugh, enough already...!
Get out of your head,
and just focus!”

The girl yelled this while
pushing the pillar from beside me.
As she did, a light shot out.

The fire...isn’t hot anymore...?
Has this girl...been blessed
by some kind of spirit...?

Whatever this power may be,
with this, I can...!

I gathered all of my strength,
and shoved the pillar
off of Mother.
